perturbation.original_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be for 3 years (the "Initial Term") commencing on the date first set forth above (the "Commencement Date") and ending on the 3rd anniversary of the Commencement Date. This Agreement will automatically renew for successive one year terms (each a "Renewal Term", and together with the Initial Term, the "Term"), unless either Charterer or Owner elects not to renew this Agreement by providing the other party with written notice of such election 30 days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or Renewal Term, as applicable, at which point this Agreement will automatically terminate.
perturbation.changed_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be for 3 years (the "Initial Term") commencing on the date first set forth above (the "Commencement Date") and ending on the 3rd anniversary of the Commencement Date. This Agreement will automatically renew for successive one year terms (each a "Renewal Term", and together with the Initial Term, the "Term"), unless either Charterer or Owner elects not to renew this Agreement by providing the other party with written notice of such election 60 days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or Renewal Term, as applicable, at which point this Agreement will automatically terminate.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a 30-day notice period for non-renewal. The modified text changes this to a 60-day notice period. This creates a direct conflict regarding the required notice period for terminating the agreement, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes over whether proper notice was given.

perturbation.original_text: Charterer agrees to pay to Owner a fee of $______ per gallon of product transported. Owner will invoice such fees to Charterer on a monthly basis and Charterer will pay such invoiced amounts within 30 days of invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: Charterer agrees to pay to Owner a fee of $______ per gallon of product transported. Owner will invoice such fees to Charterer on a monthly basis and Charterer will pay such invoiced amounts within 45 days of invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment within 30 days of the invoice date. The modified text extends this to 45 days. This creates a contradiction regarding the payment deadline, leading to potential disagreements about late payment penalties or breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: All monthly Owner invoices to Charterer for rates and cost items will be paid by Charterer within 30 days of invoice date in accordance with Owner's normal payment protocols, which will be specified in the applicable invoice. Each monthly invoice shall be itemized to include charges by applicable vessel by day.
perturbation.changed_text: All monthly Owner invoices to Charterer for rates and cost items will be paid by Charterer within 60 days of invoice date in accordance with Owner's normal payment protocols, which will be specified in the applicable invoice. Each monthly invoice shall be itemized to include charges by applicable vessel by day.
perturbation.explanation: In Exhibit A, Section 1, the original text states that invoices will be paid within 30 days of the invoice date. The modified text changes the payment term to within 60 days of the invoice date, creating a contradiction within the same agreement regarding payment deadlines, causing ambiguity and potential payment disputes.
